para.p: Our proof of Watson’s lemma follows Miller. 1 1 footnote 1 Peter D. Miller, Applied Asymptotic Analysis, p. 53, Proposition 2.1.

ϕ

: F
→
( 0 , ∞ )
C
defined by

Math.text: F * lambda = ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t))
formulae@(F * lambda similar-to ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((g ^ n * 0 * Gamma * (sigma + n + 1)) / (nfactorial * lambda ^ (sigma + n + 1))), lambda to infinity)

para.p:
Take
g
to be
C ∞
on some interval with left endpoint
<
0
and right endpoint
s
,
0 < s < T
. For
p
a nonnegative integer and
> λ 1
, define

Math.text: F _ p * lambda = ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))

para.p:
which satisfies, doing the change of variable
= τ
⁢ λ t
,

Math.text: F _ p * lambda = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) = lambda ^ (- (sigma + p + 1)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- tau) * tau ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(tau)) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) = lambda ^ (- (sigma + p + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + p + 1) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))
F _ p * lambda
((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))

lambda ^ (- (sigma + p + 1)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- tau) * tau ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(tau)) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))
lambda ^ (- (sigma + p + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + p + 1) - ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))

para.p: Using the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality,

Math.tex: \displaystyle\int_{s}^{\infty}e^{-\lambda t}t^{\sigma+p}dt=\int_{s}^{\infty}e^% {-\lambda t/2}e^{-\lambda t/2}t^{\sigma+p}dt\leq\left(\int_{s}^{\infty}e^{-% \lambda t}dt\right)^{1/2}\left(\int_{s}^{\infty}e^{-\lambda t}t^{2\sigma+2p}dt% \right)^{1/2}=e^{-\lambda s/2}\lambda^{-1/2}\left(\int_{s}^{\infty}e^{-\lambda t% }t^{2\sigma+2p}dt\right)^{1/2}<e^{-\lambda s/2}\left(\int_{0}^{\infty}e^{-t}t^% {2\sigma+2p}dt\right)^{1/2}=e^{-\lambda s/2}\Gamma(2\sigma+2p+1)^{1/2}.
Math.text: ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) = ((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- (lambda * t) / 2) * e ^ (- (lambda * t) / 2) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t)) less= (((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * (((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) = e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * (((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) less e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * (((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) = e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * Gamma * (2 * sigma + 2 * p + 1) ^ (1 / 2)
((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))
((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- (lambda * t) / 2) * e ^ (- (lambda * t) / 2) * t ^ (sigma + p) * differential-d@(t))
(((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2) * (((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * lambda ^ (- 1 / 2) * (((integral _ s) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * (((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- t) * t ^ (2 * sigma + 2 * p) * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / 2)
e ^ (- (lambda * s) / 2) * Gamma * (2 * sigma + 2 * p + 1) ^ (1 / 2)

Math.text: F _ p * lambda = lambda ^ (- (sigma + p + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + p + 1) + o _ (list@(m, p)) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + m + 1))

para.p:
as
→ λ ∞
.
Write

Math.text: F * lambda = ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t)) + ((integral _ s) ^ T)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t))

para.p: One the one hand,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ s) ^ T)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t))) less= ((integral _ s) ^ T)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * absolute-value@(phi * t) * differential-d@(t)) less= e ^ (- lambda * s) * ((integral _ s) ^ T)@(absolute-value@(phi * t) * differential-d@(t)) less= e ^ (- lambda * s) * (norm@(phi)) _ (L ^ 1)

para.p:
which shows that for any nonnegative integer
n
,

Math.text: ((integral _ s) ^ T)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t)) = o _ n * lambda ^ (- (sigma + n + 1))

para.p:
as
→ λ ∞
.

One the other hand, for each nonnegative integer
N
, Taylor’s theorem tells us that the function
:
r N
→
( r , s )
C
defined by

Math.text: formulae@(r _ N * t = g * t - ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * t ^ n), t element-of open-interval@(r, s))

para.p: satisfies

Math.text: absolute-value@(r _ N * t) less= supremum@(absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot ((absolute-value@(t)) ^ (N + 1) / (N + 1)factorial))

para.p:
where the supremum is over those
τ
strictly between
0
and
t
. Then for
∈ t
( 0 , s )
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(r _ N * t) less= (supremum _ (0 less tau less s))@(absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot (t ^ (N + 1) / (N + 1)factorial))

para.p:
Using the definition of
r N
,

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * phi * t * differential-d@(t)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * t ^ n * d * t)) + ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t)) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * F _ n * lambda) + ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t))

((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * F _ n * lambda) + ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t))

para.p:
and using the inequality for
⁢
r N
( t )
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t))) less= ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * absolute-value@(r _ N * t) * differential-d@(t)) less= (supremum _ (0 less tau less s))@((absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot (1 / (N + 1)factorial)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + N + 1) * differential-d@(t))) = (supremum _ (0 less tau less s))@((absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot (1 / (N + 1)factorial)) * F _ (N + 1) * lambda * d * t)
absolute-value@(((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t)))
((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * absolute-value@(r _ N * t) * differential-d@(t))
(supremum _ (0 less tau less s))@((absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot (1 / (N + 1)factorial)) * ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ (sigma + N + 1) * differential-d@(t)))
(supremum _ (0 less tau less s))@((absolute-value@(g ^ (N + 1) * tau) cdot (1 / (N + 1)factorial)) * F _ (N + 1) * lambda * d * t)

para.p: Using this and (),

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ s)@(e ^ (- lambda * t) * t ^ sigma * r _ N * t * differential-d@(t)) = O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2))

para.p:
Putting together what we have shown, for any nonnegative integer
N
, as
→ λ ∞
,

Math.text: F * lambda = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * F _ n * lambda) + O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2)) + O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2)) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + n + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + n + 1)) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@((((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) cdot o _ (list@(N, n))) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 1))) + O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2)) = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + n + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + n + 1)) + o _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 1))
F * lambda
((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * F _ n * lambda) + O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2)) + O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2))

((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + n + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + n + 1)) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@((((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) cdot o _ (list@(N, n))) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 1)))
+ O _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 2))
((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ N)@(((g ^ n * 0) / nfactorial) * lambda ^ (- (sigma + n + 1)) * Gamma * (sigma + n + 1)) + o _ N * lambda ^ (- (sigma + N + 1))

para.p: which proves the claim. ∎

Math.text: ((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) / (e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * ((- M * f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) / 2) ^ (- 1 / 2))

para.p: is lower bounded by

Math.text: (((- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) + epsilon) / (- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0)) ^ (- 1 / 2) * ((integral _ (- delta * square-root@(M * (((- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) + epsilon) / 2)))) ^ (delta * square-root@(M * (((- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) + epsilon) / 2))))@(e ^ (- y ^ 2) * differential-d@(y))

so we get that the liminf of () as
→ M ∞
is lower bounded by

Math.text: (((- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) + epsilon) / (- f ^ prime2 * x _ 0)) ^ (- 1 / 2) * square-root@(pi)

para.p:
But this is true for all
> ϵ 0
and () and its liminf do not depend on
ϵ

π

Math.text: (limit-infimum _ (M to infinity))@(((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) / (e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * ((- M * f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) / (2 * pi)) ^ (- 1 / 2))) >= 1

para.p: Therefore

Math.text: ((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) less (b - a) * e ^ (M * C) + e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * (- (M / (2 * pi)) * (f ^ prime2 * x _ 0 + epsilon)) ^ (- 1 / 2)

para.p: which we rearrange as

Math.text: ((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) / (e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * (- (M / (2 * pi)) * (f ^ prime2 * x _ 0 + epsilon)) ^ (- 1 / 2)) less (b - a) * e ^ (- M * eta) * (- (M / (2 * pi)) * (f ^ prime2 * x _ 0 + epsilon)) ^ (1 / 2) + 1

para.p:
As
→ M ∞
the first term on the right-hand side tends to
0
, because
> η 0
. Therefore,

Math.text: (limit-supremum _ (M to infinity))@(((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) / (e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * (- (M / (2 * pi)) * (f ^ prime2 * x _ 0 + epsilon)) ^ (- 1 / 2))) less= 1

para.p:
This is true for all
> ϵ 0
, so it holds that

Math.text: (limit-supremum _ (M to infinity))@(((integral _ a) ^ b)@(e ^ (M * f * x) * differential-d@(x)) / (e ^ (M * f * x _ 0) * ((- M * f ^ prime2 * x _ 0) / (2 * pi)) ^ (- 1 / 2))) less= 1

para.p: completing the proof. ∎
